LeaseQuery is seeking a Data Analyst with data audit and data quality management background. In this role you will perform data quality assessments, analyze patterns, identify root cause(s) and develop automated variance tracking solutions in partnership with data engineers and business stakeholders.

LeaseQuery is a FinTech lease accounting software that helps companies easily comply with new lease accounting guidelines. We provide the unique ability to work at a company who has the best-reviewed product in the market and a company culture that has awarded us one of the best places to work. We are fanatical about culture as shown in our 15+ perfect 5-star reviews on Glassdoor.

Responsibilities
Conduct data quality analysis of complex data sets.
Perform root cause analysis and recommend resolution plans.
Identify patterns useful for ongoing variance tracking.
Collaborate with data engineers to implement database and data quality process improvements.
Develop automated variance tracking solutions using advanced coding skills and Machine Learning capabilities.
Requirements
Undergraduate degree in Analytics, Finance or Accounting.
3-5 years of experience in an analytic role conducting detailed data and root cause analysis
1-3 years of experience with data science and/or Machine Learning model development.
Knowledge of user generated transactional data and/or accounting processes.
Strong Python and SQL programming skills.
Solid understanding of database architecture.
Ability to problem solve, develop & implement solutions.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel including pivot tables.
Excellent oral and written communication skills including ability to present to and influence senior and executive management.
Willingness and ability to learn.
Preferred Skills
Experience with Alteryx and/or Knime data flow development.
Tableau certification or recent hands-on experience a plus.
Any development experience would be a plus - .NET experience would be a huge help

Job Description:
Description

SHIFT: Day Job

SCHEDULE: Full-time

Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.

This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.

**This position must be located in one of the following offices; Atlanta, GA, Mason, OH; Virginia Beach, VA, or Indianapolis, IN

(This position will start remote and return to the office once Anthem is cleared for office work...TBD)

Responsible for building and implementing enterprise business solutions utilizing robotic process automation (RPA) software.

Business RPA Analyst

Primary duties include, but are not limited to:
Creates and maintains BOTs that will interact with multiple internal and external applications.
Participates in the technical design and development including creating and maintaining solution documentation.
Engages cross-functional team members effectively to develop high quality products.
Maintains and improves existing applications by working closely with business stakeholders to map existing work processes and identify productivity opportunities.
Ensures best practices are being followed at each stage of development and test procedures and scenarios for the pre-UAT phases are documented.
Business RPA Consultant/Developer

Primary duties include, but are not limited to:
Create and maintain BOTs that will interact with multiple internal and external applications.
Host process design sessions with Business Analysts for process identification and feasibility analysis of new opportunities.
Participate in the technical design and development including creating and maintaining solution documentation such as PDD and SDD.
Create Proof of Concepts.
Provide lights-on and change management administrative support.
Lead structured peer reviews and conduct code reviews.
Ensures best practices are being followed at each stage of SDLC.
Qualifications

Business RPA Analyst

Requires a BS/BA and 5 years of relevant experience, at least one year’s experience building Robots utilizing Robotics Process Automation (RPA) software, or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. Degree in Accounting, Finance or IT preferred. RPA Certification preferred.

Business RPA Consultant/Developer

Requires a BS/BA and 7 years of relevant experience, at least two years’ experience building Robots utilizing Robotics Process Automation (RPA) software, or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background. Degree in Accounting, Finance or IT preferred. RPA Certification preferred. Experience in leading other associates in a team environment to drive business solutions preferred.

Preferred Experience:

At least two years as RPA developer (UiPath highly preferred or Blue Prism) five years of design and development of enterprise solutions using VB.Net, C#, or Python. Practical experience with Alteryx and Tableau a plus. Advanced web development experience.

Profile Summary:

The Sr. Business Analyst role will be responsible for the accurate and timely reporting of derivatives and other investments. Assists in formulating creative, technical contributions to defining user business and functional requirements for enhancements and projects and implementing IT business solutions. Acts as an adept analytical resource focusing on critical business priorities. Assists in establishing plans for defining, delivering, enabling and supporting information technology components into the organization architecture. Our ideal candidate would bring previous experience as a technical liaison between IT and the Accounting business. Additionally be able to manage accounting data and utilization of querying tools.

Profile Description:
Completion of daily/monthly close procedures including accounting data reconciliation between general ledger, derivatives sub-system, data warehouse and core datasets
Ensure accurate and timely resolution of daily exceptions from the derivatives sub-system including research on issues and proper corrective action
Evaluate current processes and participate in process improvement projects
Provide consulting regarding the practices and methods for defining detailed business requirements including planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to corporate standards
Review business requirements which describe the business needs and the scope of the solution.
Document and refine business requirements to describe the business needs to a functional requirement level without presuming a technical solution
Support the execution of the development pipeline and delivery of Voyas software products including vendor solutions to QA, and ultimately to production
Work in execution of product development across all teams as part of the development lifecycle
Identify applicable technology alternatives to given business problems with the assistance and direction of the Business Solutions Consultant
Prepare US GAAP 10-K and 10-Q financial reports on quarterly basis
Prepare quarterly and annual Statutory filings
Assist department with other derivatives reporting deliverables including business unit and management reporting
Perform various analysis to explain balance sheet and income statement movements under US GAAP and Statutory accounting bases
Ensure department documentation is compliant with internal policies and Sarbanes-Oxley
Facilitate internal and external audits of derivatives and other investment security types

Job Title: Sr. Analyst, Data Services- Food Service and Distributor Data
Job Description:
Summary
The Senior Analyst role on the CBS Distributor Data Team will be primarily focused on data analysis, support, and training for the Food Service organization, RTM, and internal/external constituents. This position acts as a Subject Matter Expert in the various areas of business processes and how they relate to The Coca-Cola System (TCCS). This position is responsible for supporting complex projects. This position will be responsible for working with the existing systems available from the Coca-Cola system to complete key tasks related to existing and new business initiatives. This position will be required to thoroughly understand Food Service and Distributor business data and have the ability to analyze it to make recommendations or business decisions. This person must be able to make business decisions independently based on analysis performed. This position will require a thorough understanding of the business processes and systems currently available within the Coca-Cola system, the various industries of our customers, and the beverage industry.
Essential job duties and responsibilities
Work closely with assigned internal and external customers to understand their business routines, performance metrics, audience, and overall role in the Coca-Cola system.
Act as an extension of customers’ teams, anticipating needs and providing excellent service in analysis and reporting.
Interfaces with TCCS customer base and internal constituents across the TCCS finance, sales and marketing organizations
Meets with constituents to understand needs, finds ways to resolve issues, and creatively offers solutions to complex business opportunities
Coordinates small to medium projects within CBS for stakeholders
Use multiple large sets of data to identify issues before they are discovered by customers
Decipher large sets of raw data to identify issues with formatting based on Coca-Cola developed requirements and external customer requirements
Communicates issues timely to constituents and provides detailed course of action for correcting complex data issues
Additional responsibilities
Creates processes to retrieve data from various internal and external sources
Creates business process flow diagrams based on project needs
Communicate clear and concise information to every level of the business
Review and explain technical requirements to vendors and customers
Route customers to the correct team or contact by applying knowledge of roles and responsibilities, governance, business processes and system ownership
Provides appropriate documentation and training as needed
Assists with technical and business issue resolution
Participates in team meetings and makes recommendations to improve processes
Responsible for administrative functions required
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Strong analytical skills
Critical thinking skills
Ability to learn complex processes related to data
Excellent written and oral communication
Detailed Knowledge of Coca-Cola Business
3-5 years of in-depth knowledge and experience with sales reporting tools
Experience with Matrix reporting tools (ASR, MSR, MVR, MAS) as well as Coca-Cola Food Service & RTM data
Proficiency in Excel & Microsoft Suite of tools
Proficient in SQL query structure including joins and aggregations
Ability to quickly learn new technologies, tools & syntax
About Company

Job Description: *POSITION PURPOSE** Working at the worlds fourth largest retailer mixes the best of many worlds: cutting-edge technologies meet real business needs meets real customers who spend billions of dollars across our stores in North America. What is like to work at The Home Depot QuoteCenter? We were a startup once upon a time and much of our startup culture still exists: the agility of a small operation, the impact that comes with being a leader in our industry. Our team uses the latest technologies to build new products that facilitat 9-figure project sales at The Home Depot. We invest proactively in our people. The mission of the QuoteCenter product team is to radically reimagine the shopping experience at Home Depot utilizing the lastest data tools and web technologies. We are searching for a Business Analyst who is passionate about partnering with the field, suppliers and merchandising to analyze, source, quote and sell large and complex bids for our Pro electrical customers. The goal of your efforts will be to increase Home Depot's Pro market penetration by rapidly analyzing materials lists, interfacing with key stakeholders, and developing and disseminating facts and figures to influence Pro purchase behavior. This is a full-time permanent role, with flexibility in location (Vancouver, WA or Atlanta, GA). We are seeking someone which a knack for linking numbers to business opportunities, and is comfortable with a high level of ambiguity and significant stakeholder communication. Experience in Excel and Tableau a strong plus. High School diploma required. **MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES** + 15% Collaboration + Work closely with internal operations teams + Navigate and troubleshoot issues and opportunities related to special order assortment, supplier lead times, pricing and volume discounts + 25% - Communicatio + Act as the point person for, and communicate with, PASA's, PAR's, Supplier reps, Merchants and others to coordinate competitive special order bids + 15% - System & Process + Be a subject matter expert on internal systems related, but not limited to, lead times, product assortment, costs, retails and bulk discounts. + 25% - Multi-tasking + Ability to oversee 2-4 projects simultaneously, recommending pricing proposals and related improvements to help close large electrical orders + 20% Analytics + Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects to gauge business value and leverage learnings for future initiatives. **NATURE AND SCOPE** + The role reports to the HDQC Manager, Pro Merchandising Strategy. The position has no direct reports. **ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS** **Environment:** Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. **Travel:** 0% **Additional Environmental Job Requirements:** **MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS** Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. **Education Required:** The knowledge, skills, and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diplomas and/or GED. **Years of Relevant Work Experience:** 2 years We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job Description
Trivest Partners, Financial Analyst, Full time, Remote

Trivest Partners is hiring a Financial Analyst at one of our Portfolio Companies. This company is the largest independent, pure-play provider of Identity & Access Management (IAM) services in North America. With a deep roster of 90+ expert consultants led by a world-class management team and expertise across all relevant IAM technologies, this organization is well-positioned to rapidly grow in the IAM market.

Position Overview:

The Financial Analyst who be responsible for financial functions including elements of the accounting close, reporting, forecasting, budgeting, systems integration as it relates to the finance and accounting functions within Netsuite, and additional responsibilities supporting the business (e.g. Sales Commissions).

The Financial Analyst will report to the Chief Financial Officer. The Financial Analyst will work closely with the rest of the Accounting, Finance and Human Resources team, and should possess the ability to work on teams and communicate effectively cross-functionally.

Key Objectives
Assist in the closing of the books by 10-days following month end, including completion of the Financial Package to Ownership
Work with the CFO and Accounting Manager on a Quickbooks to Netsuite general ledger implementation project
Timely calculation and distribution of Sales Team Commissions
Assist the CFO in key performance metric reporting (KPI’s) and further developing information tools that can add value
Working alongside the CFO in completing Cashflow forecasting every 6 weeks out 13 weeks
Working alongside the CFO in completing Budgets and Latest Estimate forecasts
Work with CFO in building financial models and manage the analysis, reporting, and monitoring of operating results in ways that are meaningful for the business. This can include customer and sku profitability.
With guidance from the CFO, analyze special projects to determine business financial benefits and impacts to the Company
Requirements
BS in Accounting or Finance. CPA preferred but not required.
2-4 years of previous work experience
Netsuite or other ERP General Ledger experience.
Strong in financial modeling (e.g. pivot tables, queries, macros) and has systems prowess.
Experience working with percentage of completion accounting/project-based businesses.
Excellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods.
If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, apply today or email shawn.lam@trivestcareers.com

Profile Summary:

The Sr. Business Analyst role will be responsible for the accurate and timely reporting of derivatives and other investments. Assists in formulating creative, technical contributions to defining user business and functional requirements for enhancements and projects and implementing IT business solutions. Acts as an adept analytical resource focusing on critical business priorities. Assists in establishing plans for defining, delivering, enabling and supporting information technology components into the organization architecture. Our ideal candidate would bring previous experience as a technical liaison between IT and the Accounting business. Additionally be able to manage accounting data and utilization of querying tools.

Profile Description:
Completion of daily/monthly close procedures including accounting data reconciliation between general ledger, derivatives sub-system, data warehouse and core datasets
Ensure accurate and timely resolution of daily exceptions from the derivatives sub-system including research on issues and proper corrective action
Evaluate current processes and participate in process improvement projects
Provide consulting regarding the practices and methods for defining detailed business requirements including planning, documentation, analysis and alignment to corporate standards
Review business requirements which describe the business needs and the scope of the solution.
Document and refine business requirements to describe the business needs to a functional requirement level without presuming a technical solution
Support the execution of the development pipeline and delivery of Voyas software products including vendor solutions to QA, and ultimately to production
Work in execution of product development across all teams as part of the development lifecycle
Identify applicable technology alternatives to given business problems with the assistance and direction of the Business Solutions Consultant
Prepare US GAAP 10-K and 10-Q financial reports on quarterly basis
Prepare quarterly and annual Statutory filings
Assist department with other derivatives reporting deliverables including business unit and management reporting
Perform various analysis to explain balance sheet and income statement movements under US GAAP and Statutory accounting bases
Ensure department documentation is compliant with internal policies and Sarbanes-Oxley
Facilitate internal and external audits of derivatives and other investment security types
Knowledge and Experience
Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience in a directly related field
5+ years of professional experience with leadership in technical accounting, information systems and business analysis
Experience working with extensive datasets in a complex environment and various reporting tools (e.g. WebFocus)
Experience with financial reporting under multiple ledgers and requirements such as US GAAP and Statutory bases.
Strong computer and automation skills, including strong proficiency in Excel spreadsheet functionality and Microsoft Access
Well developed organization and communication skills, and ability to operate in a complex and dynamic environment
CPA or investment accounting experience a plus
#LI-NA1

Critical Skills
At Voya, we have identified the following critical skills which are key to success in our culture:
Customer Focused: Passionate drive to delight our customers and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.
Critical Thinking: Thoughtful process of analyzing data and problem solving data to reach a well-reasoned solution.
Team Mentality: Partnering effectively to drive our culture and execute on our common goals.
Business Acumen: Appreciation and understanding of the financial services industry in order to make sound business decisions.
Learning Agility: Openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.
Learn more about Critical Skills.

Job Title: SW Business Analyst / System Product Owner
Job Description:
You are:

Someone who believes that software changes lives. You're passionate about technology and see the world a little differently than your peers???????everywhere you look, there's possibility, opportunity, boundaries to push and challenges to solve.

That's what we're seeking at NCR. We're a global tech company that makes life easier for you???????and people all over the world???????by enabling more than 550 million transactions every day. Restaurants, shops, banks and airports come to us for hardware, software and services. They know we have the best and brightest analysts who know the world of payments better than any other???????and relish in revealing previously unknown insights. Analysts who are instrumental in creating products than can survive under the pressure of hundreds of thousands of transactions per minute. Analysts like you.

You have:

??? Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or equivalent industry experience

??? Required 1+ years of experience as a product owner

??? Required 7+ years of experience as a software developer

??? Experience working on a software development team as a team leader

??? Experience working in an Agile software and/or computer hardware development environment

??? Excellent written and verbal communication skills

??? An analytical mind, capable of seeing the underlying connections between complex systems

??? An attention to detail with a strong focus on quality

??? An ability to discuss technical concepts with a development team and contribute to the conversation

Even better if you have:

??? Hands on experience in installation, configuration and support of cloud-based enterprise software

??? Experience with retail Point-of-Sale software

??? Experience with Scrum, SAFe or other software development methodologies

The day-to-day:

You will:

??? Perform the role of a business analyst and a product owner in a SAFe based agile software development organization

??? Gather, understand and document requirements

??? Create detailed functional specifications, user stories, acceptance criteria for product and process enhancements

??? Work together with scrum masters, technical leads, product owners, project managers and third parties to groom backlog and plan sprints

??? Interact and coordinate efforts with other scrum teams, solution managers and customers

??? Drive ongoing improvements and efficiencies in product health, operational practices, tools and processes

??? Evaluate third-party products and specifications

??? Provide estimations of work based on requirements

??? Educate others on areas of expertise

??? Work under the supervision of an Engineering Manager

??? Perform other job related duties as assigned

Job Title: Scientific Data Analyst with Security Clearance
Job Description: Description Job Description: The Leidos Health Group is seeking Scientific Data Analysts, contingent upon contract award, in Atlanta, GA. This program will fulfill the requirement for a self-motivated and detail-oriented scientific data analyst to provide effective and innovative data science solutions for the CDC COVID-19 pandemic response. To produce and review protocols for laboratory and epidemiological studies, study protocols, and other data collection methods. Develop statistical code for analyses to support programmatic activities, and to provide expertise in analyzing large datasets. This project requires strong data science, statistical, data management and SAS or R programming expertise. Ability to devise study protocols and create documentation for programs is a requirement. Primary Responsibilities This task requires 1) understanding and application of general statistical approaches including multivariate techniques (logistic regression, generalized linear models, proportional hazards modeling), and use of ; 2) strong SAS programming sampling methodologies; 3) orderly management of microcomputer files in a Windows environment to develop databases and analysis programs for data analysis; 4) statistical analysis of large, complex survey data requiring the use of SUDAAN; 5) developing statistical reports and presenting data in Excel, particularly the ability to efficiently produce large complex Excel tables efficiently and reports from SAS in customized formats to fit the needs of periodic reports; 6) using PROC REPORT and other report production features of SAS to produce excel files of COVID-19 estimates; 7) importing, exporting, and manipulating data files (SAS, SUDAAN), including recoding, transforming, and creating variables to accommodate analytic needs; 8) using web applications or PowerBI to create interactive online reports/dashboards and manage web content; 9) preparing written reports and presenting at sectional or national meetings; and 10) performing other analytical and data related duties, as needed. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Epidemiology, Statistics, Biostatistics, or Math and 7 years of experience or MS, MPH, MSPH and 5 years of experience. Preferred Qualifications Experience with statistical data analysis and use of data analysis tools (e.g. SAS, SUDAAN, R, REDCap, Microsoft Access, Excel, EpiInfo, STATA, PowerBI, etc. Requires ability to obtain Public Trust Clearance. External Referral Bonus: Eligible Potential for Telework: Yes Clearance Level Required: Public Trust Travel: No Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 Shift: Day Requisition Category: Professional Job Family: Data Scientist Leidos Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com . Pay and Benefits Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here . Securing Your Data Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to [email protected] . Commitment to Diversity All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Job Title: Business Analyst / Product Owner (Payments Industry Experience)
Job Description:
Business Analyst / Product Owner (Payments Industry Experience)

Stratfield is seeking a Business Analyst / Product Owner with prior experience working in the payments industry. Our client is seeking to add to their internal team to help with an exciting payment solution offering. This role will start off working 100% remotely with the possibility of working in the Atlanta office down the road. Candidates must be open to 25% travel to client sites as needed.
PLEASE NOTE: This role can be contract, contract-to-hire, or direct hire, it is up to you!
Responsibilities:
Conduct analysis, gathering requirements, and documenting user stories for building and deploying products and services.
Must be willing to be flexible in job duties when asked to assist in other areas of the business.
Maintain the product backlog of new business features as well as maintenance and support items.
Understanding all aspects of the Agile project lifecycle.
Understanding the business processes, story mapping, documenting detailed business requirements, developing functional designs, conducting gap analysis, etc. that bring the client and project team to a common understanding of the product and how it will satisfy the business need.
Building strong relationships among the business and IT teams.
Plan, organize and facilitate User Acceptance Testing.
Serving as a product expert and providing triage and resolution of production defects.
Utilize effective meeting management skills to initiate, develop agenda, conduct, and communicate decisions so that all appropriate parties are aligned and kept up-to-date.
Maintain open and constant communication amongst the team, management, and customers regarding project status and sprint outcomes.
Promote a collaborative working relationship with the team and customers.
Requirements
2+ years of experience and successful track record as a Product Owner or Business Analyst in the payments industry.
Experience in software development, business analysis, and system lifecycle development.
Prior experience in the payments industry is a requirement.
Logical understanding of how the system functionality interacts or changes with existing system modules, interfaces, etc.
Ability to "think out of the box " and develop creative solutions.
Must demonstrate proactive client service skills.
Basic understanding of web application and SaaS concepts and associative architectures to be conversant with the development team.
About Stratfield Consulting
We started Stratfield Consulting with the belief that companies are looking for a more reliable consulting, staffing, and recruiting firm to deliver an expanding list of projects. Our objective is to be the most trusted firm for our clients.
We are very proud of the people that we invite into our firm. Our people are:
Experienced consultants - Smart problem solvers.
Easy to work with - Friendly, modest, and humble.
Earnest - We care enough to do the extra work to ensure project success.
Engaged - 100% committed to project success. We believe that our clients come first.

Job Description
We are currently seeking a Sales Operations Analyst to join a growing team. The ideal candidate will be focusing on sales enablement and productivity issues, the Sales Operations Analyst is an expert on how sales associates spend their time and a valuable resource for sales associates and leaders by providing data, tools and support to help them sell more effectively and efficiently. Working closely with our Sales Operations Administrator, the Sales Operations Analyst play a critical role in helping manage the company's CRM.

Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
5-10 years of related work experience in a B2B sales operations, customer facing, sales, marketing, or other commercial role
Excellent project management and communication skills
Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint
Salesforce user experience
Experience being a change agent and persuading others to implement process changes and improvements
Preferred Skills/Knowledge:
Salesforce Administrator Certification (CRT101 or more advanced)
Demonstrated Salesforce architecture experience
ERP user experience
Exposure to B2B sales processes and/or methodologies
Main responsibilities include:
Sales Enablement and Productivity Improvement. The Sales Operations Analyst works with sales leadership to maximize selling time in the field.
Seeks to understand how sellers spend their time and what the typical pain points of the roles are, including mapping out all internal process and job requirements for sellers
Surveys the sales team to identify distractions in the day to day role and works towards optimizing those situations for sellers and sales leaders
Leads and gathers regular feedback from the CRM Advocate Team and other CRM users to identify and address time consuming processes or non-sales related job requirements and makes recommendations to simplify, improve or eliminate them
Works with sales, sales leadership, and marketing to constantly identify and address opportunities to leverage Salesforce and other tools to improve current business processes and increase sales team productivity
Proactively develops dashboards and tools that help sellers to improve productivity, sales leaders increase accountability, and sales executives to monitor performance towards achieving strategic sales initiatives
Monitors, researches as necessary, and serves as subject matter expert on all available and new sales enablement tools and Salesforce apps
Conducts regular analysis of sales funnel metrics and make recommendations for performance improvements
Salesforce Administration. The Sales Operations Analyst will have overall responsibility for managing the longer-term direction for Printpack’s CRM for all organization users. Duties will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Proposes and monitors CRM user adoption metrics
Develops and executes initiatives and programs to improve CRM user adoption and maximize the company’s investment
Manages the overall relationship with Salesforce, including solicitation of support for training initiatives, evaluation of new products and services, and maintenance of supply agreements
Selects and manages third party resource(s) as necessary to provide customization and developer services for Salesforce improvement projects or ongoing support when Sales Operations Analyst workload requires off loading
Collaborates with Sales Operations Specialist in planning, scoping, budgeting and executing larger scale Salesforce improvement projects to include architecture and automation
Serves as backup to Sales Operations Specialist on daily Salesforce maintenance activities and user questions and issues
Customer Analysis. The Sales Operations Analyst conducts ad hoc customer, profitability and financial analysis upon request.

Job Title: Business Systems Programmer/Analyst
Department: Information Technology
Reporting to: Director of Business Intelligence
FLSA Status: Exempt
Date Prepared: 4/17/19
Salary Range: $80-90k
Job Summary:


The responsibility of the Business Systems Programmer/Analyst is to design, develop, and support new internal solutions, maintain and improve existing custom solutions, manage third-party development resources, and ensure the integrity and availability of The Krystal Companys business applications, databases and reporting environment. This position plays an integral role in making sure that technology-enabled business functions run smoothly by supporting existing systems and implementing new systems and processes when suitable. A successful candidate will be self-motivated and driven to investigate and resolve issues with legacy applications and data integrations while balancing multiple projects. The candidate will have excellent troubleshooting and communication skills as well as the ability to work directly with business leaders to design and develop new solutions to support both new and existing business needs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


This role will be responsible for custom business application support, application development, SQL database application support and data management.
Responsible for supporting and troubleshooting custom legacy solutions, reports and integration processes
Understands business processes for invoicing, food cost/inventory management, labor, payroll, accounting, and retail sales
Analyze department applications, programming, and operations; identify database and development requirements; evaluate existing systems and design proposed systems
Maintain and document the database and application architecture and any changes to related business processes
Maintain data integration and reporting job schedules and data dependencies
Ensure business continuity and disaster recovery operations for business applications, databases, and integrations
Stay abreast of relevant technologies to continually improve The Krystal Companys technology portfolio
Assist in planning the technology strategy as it relates to infrastructure for data integration, storage, reporting and custom applications
Maintain, modify or improve existing custom applications
Implement security, configuration settings, database settings
Recommend, design, and develop solutions by defining database physical structures and functional capabilities that improve business processes and the efficiency and reliability of data management and reporting
Support database functions by designing and developing utilities as needed
Ability to prioritize work and exercise good judgement while managing multiple tasks involved in support, development, and project management
Education and Experience Requirements:

University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Business Administration; equivalent experience accepted.
6+ Years experience in application development, SQL development, data management, and report writing.


Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
Essential Skills and Experience:
SQL Server 2003,2008 (R2), 2010, 2012, 2016
Cognos 7, 8, 11
IIS, SSRS, SSIS
Table Relationships and Data Conversions
Report Writing
Data integrations and transport
System Life Cycle Development Methodology
Project Management Skills
Programming: .NET, C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET, SQL
Planning and Organizing- Accomplishes goals through establishing priorities and organizing own workload to meet deadlines in a timely fashion. Manages time wisely and effectively prioritizes multiple, competing tasks. Plans, organizes, and actively manages meetings for maximum productivity.
Communication- Establishes, monitors, and improves communication channels that foster open communications, upward, downward, and among peers. Matches the right medium (e.g., phone, email, etc.) to the message and uses good judgment in sharing information.
Results Oriented- Influences events to achieve or exceed goals. Is dedicated to achieving outcomes without compromising core processes, values, or procedures. Conveys a sense of urgency to make things happen wants results. Respects the need to balance short- and long-term goals. Have the energy / work ethic to maintain the pace required to produce company results.
Problem Solving/Decision Making - Considers options and alternative courses of action to make rational and realistic decisions in a timely manner. Asks open-ended questions to gather information and listens carefully to response(s). Uses resources to gather collective ideas on issues to better arrive at a timely decision. Skill Requirements: (X = Required for job)

Senior Data Analyst - Insider Risk

Location: Remote - US

The Dell Security & Resiliency organization (SRO) manages the security risk across all aspects of Dell’s business. We are currently experiencing incredible growth in order to meet the security needs of the world’s largest technology company. With team members located in over 15 countries, you will have an excellent opportunity to influence the security culture at Dell and further develop your career.

Overview

Reporting to the Insider Risk Operations team within the Cybersecurity Intelligence and Response organization, the Senior Data Analyst uses data to proactively identify potential high-risk activity. S/he will work closely with the Insider Risk Investigations team and Data Engineer to identify trends, patterns, repeat activity which may pose a threat to Dell. Participating in all stages of insider risk investigations from planning, detection, collection, analysis, and reporting, the Senior Insider Risk Analyst completes documentation and procedures for testing, installation, maintenance, and training of Insider Risk software and infrastructure.

The ideal candidate is a strong team player that succeeds in a fast-paced and dynamic global environment. Candidates must be able to work proactively and demonstrate exceptional organizational and time management skills. Exceptional communication skills are a must.

Key Responsibilities
Monitor for and detect potential insider risks from behavior analytic use cases, various log sources, and defined risk thresholds
Detect and investigate anomalous behavior that may indicate threats to Intellectual Property (IP) assets; consider the significance, accuracy, and reliability of incoming information
Collaborate with Data Engineer on building/updating data models
Participate in designing, testing and deployment of new insider risk tools or solutions
Develop specific expertise in areas such as Insider Threat models, discern patterns of complex behavior, and provide an accurate understanding of present and future threats to Dell’s IP
Develop and maintain comprehensive operating & process documentation
Standardize process and procedures and provide continual process improvement
Essential Requirements
Bachelor’s degree with 8+ years relevant experience; or equivalent professional experience in a similar role
2+ years’ experience acting in an insider threat or security incident response role with responsibility of evaluating insider threats, responding accordingly
Experience with one or more major insider risk investigation tools in an enterprise (End point monitoring, DLP, user behavior analytics)
Strong data analysis skills: ability to identify trends/patterns/anomalies for potential risk
Must be a US Citizen; ability to obtain and maintain U.S. Government security clearance
Desirable Requirements
6+ years Information Security and or Computer Forensics experience
Experience working in a SOC environment is helpful
Understanding of commonly used targeted Insider Threat and Data Exfiltration techniques, tactics, and procedures
Experience working with end point agent deployment in a large enterprise
Experience with ObserveIT and/or Exabeam
Working knowledge of computer forensic concepts
Familiar with Data Privacy laws and the associated security requirements
EnCE, ACE, GCFE, GCFA or other SANS certification
CISSP or similar Security certifications
Key Characteristics
Problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to read, write and speak English
Strong written and oral communication skills
Must work well independently and with others as part of larger team and be able to collaborate on cross-functional teams

Company Overview


Dematic is an intralogistics innovator that designs, builds and supports intelligent, automated solutions for manufacturing, warehouse and distribution environments for customers that are powering the future of commerce. With engineering centers, manufacturing facilities and service centers located in more than 25 countries, Dematic’s global network of 8,000 employees have helped achieve more than 6,000 worldwide customer installations for some of the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in Atlanta, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, supply chain solutions and related services, and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

The Role


Dematic is hiring for a Senior Global Business process analyst role. Are you ready to take on a challenging strategic leadership role supporting our global products and services execution? This individual will partner with leadership to identify current process and propose best practices, gain alignment, and standardize current tools and processes across six global regions. This would include modeling, pricing, approvals, and other commercial operations activities.

The Business Process Analyst role who will report directly to the Vice President of Global Services. This role will be responsible for enabling global services growth, by driving capabilities and simplifying business execution across the services business globally.

Essential Role and Responsibilities:
Provide global leadership to Dematic’s services execution and customer support tools
Recommend and implement next generation tools and processes (Digital tools)
Establish global processes for supporting customer issue resolution and emergent support
Implement effective cost-model that best serves the business and bid optimization tools
Implement common maintenance management systems and contracting processes across Dematic services network
Build roadmap with Dematic IT team for tool implementation, partnering with leadership
Operationalize services tool and process review
Full ownership of key global services processes and tools across global network
Eliminate waste in core services processes and simplify region of tools to common platforms
Partner with commercial operations teams to drive a one ecosystem that spans from sales to service delivery
Leadership of a new program to analyze and predict market entitlement for customer services


What We Are Looking For


Qualification Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in engineering or computer science, or similiar education.
8+ years of experience in operations or tools & processes
Excellent communication, organization, and influencing skills at all levels both internal and external and competence in making timely, effective, principles-based decisions.
Proven professional experience driving large scale execution of programs or initiatives in a matrixed environment
Lean six sigma experience or PMP preferred, but not required
Ability to travel based on business needs
Prior experience with Salesforce and CMMS platforms

"Sr. Business Analyst
Description:

UST Global® is looking for a SR. Business analyst, to work with agile product management and engineering team to successfully deliver features and products to the market. Product Owner will be responsible for certain key functional areas of the product and will be the go-to person for these areas including defining features and user stories. The Product Owner will work closely with assigned scrum team to translate these to technical tasks and be responsible for overall delivery of product features within quarterly releases. In addition, Product Owner will be responsible for helping to evangelize the product to marketing, sales, pre-sales and professional services teams and being the SME for questions and clarifications.

As a Senior Business Analyst , it’s an opportunity to :
•Author requirements and user stories for product features working with stakeholders (both internal and external) as needed ensuring that stakeholder and market needs are met.
•Technical aptitude; programming and/or UX (User Experience) background a strong plus
•Familiar and have experience in using agile/scrum methodologies such as SAFe to drive and deliver product releases.
•Provide week-to-week tactical objectives to scrum team, and provide quick JIT decisions to system level questions and defect triage.
•Drive and own backlog grooming and management, prioritize the iteration and drive acceptance testing and delivery of iteration
•Work with 3rd party system integrators to drive process on schedule and on budget.
•Drive beta and pilot programs with early-stage features, Proof of concepts, etc.
•Be the voice of the product and company at system demos, sales calls, conferences and industry forums.
•Validates and sign’s off on all major design changes, epics, and stories
•Partner with product management, application architects, and development manager to help establish vision, release and annual program backlogs
•Research to identify needs that new or improved products can satisfy by analyzing and compare competitors’ products as well as meet with customers to discuss their requirements
•Responsible for coordinating and working closely with technical writer leader, engineers, and product management to produce product documentation such as user guides, release notes, internal and external training.
You bring:
•Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent.

The candidate should demonstrate a willingness to share knowledge, excellent listening skills and strong analytical skills. The candidate must be able to work effectively under project and daily deadlines."

Senior Data Analyst
Location/City: Any US location (offices in Atlanta, GA and Playa Vista, CA)

Responsibilities
We are looking for a sharp, highly-motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our team. If you have a natural curiosity, the technical skill to apply that curiosity in investigating large data sets, and an ability to tell a story with data and visualization, we want to hear from you! This is a high-impact role that will bridge the gap between the business and data by collaborating with our executive stakeholders and our external partners to derive insights from our data and drive improvements to the business. In addition to helping the company make data-driven decisions to improve operations, your work will be used in newspaper and magazine articles and in discussions with policymakers. This will require a solid understanding of the company’s strategic and operational goals as well as a customer-first mindset and the ability to communicate at the executive level.
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:
Work with our bank transaction and customer event data to develop insights about the nature of employment and earnings for our Members.
Surface data-driven insights that drive strategy and optimal decision making for the leaders across the organization.
Create visualizations and other reporting that distill complex data into actionable information for executives and external stakeholders.
Help drive a data-first culture where data is understood and leveraged in decision making.
Effectively balance competing priorities and deadlines, with an eye on both short term delivery with long term direction and value.
Create testing and monitoring processes to ensure that our data is of the highest quality.
Automate relentlessly so your and others’ time can be spent on high-value analysis rather than running reports.
Collaborate with the data team and Chief Data Officer to define the technical strategy for Steady’s data ecosystem

Skills & Requirements
Minimum of 3 years experience (5-7 years preferred) performing exploratory data analysis to understand the characteristics of a data set and identify patterns.
Demonstrated experience of efficient manipulation and storage of large datasets
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, making assumptions, drawing conclusions and distilling complex analysis for non-technical audiences
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization as well as with external stakeholders
Hands on experience and expertise with SQL, Spark, Python (preferred) or R
Strong data visualization skills (experience with Tableau preferred)
Experience with data warehousing, preferably with Snowflake, and knowledge of ETL/ELT best practices.
Familiarity and experience with the AWS data ecosystem (S3, AWS Glue, EMR, etc.)
Experience with bank or credit card transaction data preferred
Experience with statistical models and machine learning or with working closely with Data Scientists a plus
Comfortable working cross-functionally with different parts of the organization and with distributed teams across multiple offices and timezones
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, high-energy environment with shifting priorities


Benefits
We value our Steady Team Members and are committed to their success. We are located in downtown Atlanta near MARTA, as well as in Playa Vista CA. We offer competitive compensation packages and a 100% company-paid benefits package including medical, dental, and vision. Steady is a relaxed, casual work environment with flexible hours and lunch provided once weekly in addition to a weekly meal stipend. We also offer a generous PTO plan, 401K, and future growth opportunities within the company. We strive to maintain a positive and fun environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company.
About Steady
Steady is a mission-driven business that helps people earn more. Through the free Steady app users can build & track income, networks, and buying power – allowing them to augment retirement savings, work around childcare responsibilities, pay down debt, save for purchases, and supplement their income from primary employers, while limiting their income volatility and better positioning themselves for access to a sustainable financial services ecosystem.
Every Steady member will build something different. We celebrate those who take the initiative to create a path that works for them. Whatever that looks like, Steady is there to support it, providing a stable foundation that allows people to build financial success over a lifetime.

Mission: Steady turns the tables by putting workers back in charge of their financial future with an income-building platform that creates financial stability and helps its users to take charge of their future.

For more information, visit us at www.steadyapp.com or on Twitter @TheSteadyApp.

Job Title: Enterprise Systems Senior Business Analyst – WMS
Job Description:
Overview


The WMS Systems Business Analyst is responsible for the data flows, integrations and configuration of the Chick-fil-A Supply Warehouse Management System. This person is responsible for understanding business needs and working with business owners and IT to define technical requirements to support those needs. This role will be responsible for supporting both the distribution and upstream food production businesses.

About Chick-fil-A Supply

A wholly owned subsidiary of Chick-fil-A, Inc., Chick-fil-A Supply™ is a distribution service provider focused entirely on serving the unique needs of Chick-fil-A restaurants.

Due to steady, year-over-year sales and volume growth, combined with the complexity in our Restaurants, Chick-fil-A Supply supports current and future Restaurant needs through distribution innovation that extends the Chick-fil-A culture of care to those it serves, as well as those it employs.

This subsidiary is in the early stages of development and is a dynamic, fast-paced work environment focused on launching this new service to Restaurants across the nation.

Responsibilities


· Understand business needs and engage with IT to translate needs to technical requirements.

· Benchmark business process capabilities and cross-process integration.

· Master data setup and configuration in key enterprise systems.

· Develop and maintain best practices for TMS usage to meet business needs

· Support documentation and management of proposed, new, and existing configurations and integrations.

· Provide WMS functional expertise when partnering with business teams to help identify opportunities for improvement.

· Provide end to end solution and process expertise when connecting IT and business stakeholders and identifying new IT-enabled solutions. Evaluate packaged solution options against IT roadmap, key requirements, and various constraints.

· Develop business case documentation along with financial justification and ROI for all initiatives. Partner with IT leadership to establish project approach and timeline.

· Demonstrate skill when documenting current-state and future-state business process and data flows.

· Provide leadership during user acceptance testing and ensure that systems address business needs from users’ point of view.

· Manage multiple projects to coordinate all aspects of implementation and delivery of tasks necessary for successful project execution.

· Evaluate timing of software version upgrades and facilitate migrations.

Business Requirements

o Strong operational experience with enterprise platforms such as ERP, WMS, and TMS

o Deep understanding of chain of custody for critical value streams such as lifecycle management, order to cash, and procure to pay

o Deep understanding of data relationships to enable downstream performance

o Working knowledge of innovations in supply chain, manufacturing and distribution center facilities

o Exposure to start-up or new business development environments

Customer Relations

o Work closely with distribution centers, food production centers, CFA corporate, Operators, and business partners to ensure optimal alignment

o Possess intimate knowledge of who the customers are and the ability to put others above himself/herself

o Demonstrate the ability to value both relationships and results

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field
5+ years of experience in IT Business Analyst or related role.
3+ years of experience with JDA WMS systems.
Excellent business communication and presentation skills.
Ability to effectively coordinate multiple projects involving several departments and external consulting teams.
Excellent interpersonal, analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Deep understanding of data requirements and flows
Preferred Qualifications
Oracle Cloud ERP system experience
Cloud based system experience
3+ years of experience with JDA TMS (Transportation Management System).
Experience driving integrations between SAAS based enterprise systems and third-party stakeholders
Experience with Master Data Management across enterprise systems
Business process management experience
Minimum Years of Experience
5
Travel Requirements
10%
Required Level of Education
Bachelor's Degree
Preferred Level of Education
Masters Degree

Job Title: Business Data Analyst II

Work Location: Denver, CO

Duration: 12+ Months

Job Description:

General Functions and Responsibilities:

Work with other OIT Technical resources to install, manage and update Software Tools used in the Data Governance effort for the Joint Agency Interoperability project. Currently this is ERWin data modeler and data governance.

Managing connections between Data Governance tools and various Operational Source systems. Working with OIT technical resources, ensure connectivity successfully allows consumption of data schemas from source systems.

Ensure permission effectively allow tool administration and effective functioning of tool for business use. Diagnose and resolve permission issues associated with tool administration where necessary.

Populate and administer metadata repositories for data governance for systems in JAI workflow. Metadata repository should follow guidance from data architect, CDO and business. Propose amendments to metadata as appropriate.

Perform data discovery through reverse engineering data schema and documenting data models, entities and attributes underlying systems in JAI.

Generate data governance deliverables from the repository including data lexicons, data dictionaries, and various data artifacts along with reports and analysis.

Experience/background:

Ability to understand and support a data development lifecycle.

At least three years experience with ERWin Data Modeler and Data Governance tools, including installing, maintaining and troubleshooting server tools and experience with ERWin Data Modeler 9.0 or greater.

At least five years experience in data modeling (conceptual, logical and physical).

At least three years experience developing and administering data governance programs.

At least five years experience with technical database / metadata management.

Excellent communication skills.

Familiarity with one or more RDBMS environment including Oracle, SQL Server, Greenplum, Postgres.

Ability to understand data structures (schemas, tables and columns) in multiple environments and relate them to standard meta data structures.

Experience with data management tools such as Informatica, Data Stage and SSIS.

Familiarity with one or more RDBMS environment including Oracle, SQL Server, Greenplum, Postgres.

Microsoft SQL Management Studio

Self starter requiring limited supervision.

Ability to work with both Technical and Business representatives.

Company Description
Staff Financial Group is an Accounting and Finance Search and Staffing firm with relationships with some of the most reputable companies in Atlanta and throughout the Country. Areas of focus include Accounting, Finance, Tax, Audit/SOX, and Financial Systems.

Our unique approach, proven recruiting methodology and commitment to providing outstanding service to our clients and candidates has given us the opportunity to work with some of the most admired companies and financial professionals in Atlanta and throughout the Country.

We focus on quality in everything we do and we produce results. We are proven professionals that have a track record of aligning great companies with great people.

We add value to the hiring process by leveraging technology and networking with our strong referral base to provide our clients with the most qualified candidates currently on the market. Most of the candidates we place are referred to us, enabling us to provide our clients with highly-qualified candidates that are selectively looking for an improved professional opportunity.

Positions we fill
Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Credit & Collections, Payroll, Purchasing Professionals, Project Coordinators, Tax, Audit, Treasury, Staff Accountant, Senior Accountant, Accounting Supervisor, Accounting Manager, Controller, Financial Analyst, Finance Manager, FP&A Managers, Financial Planning & Analysis Manager, Directors of Finance, VP's of Finance, Chief Financial Officers

Position Description:
POSITION PURPOSE
Senior Operations Business Analysts are responsible for leading small to medium subsets of larger projects and initiatives and individual processes that bring value to The Home Depot. They must possess a high level of analytical ability to distinguish multiple components of a problem and develop conclusions using quantitative skills. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to leading teams on projects, effective communication to teams and other leaders, reviewing and understanding sales/financial data, identifying trends in business and the retail industry. A successful Senior Operations Business Analyst will possess and demonstrate strong leadership skills, analytical ability, and communication.
MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Lead Project Teams of Analysts and other associates
Perform data gathering tasks, synthesis - develop solutions, project/strategy planning and data utilization
Produce documents for teams and leadership to review and utilize. Deliver presentations to teams and executive leaders and sponsors
Build skills and knowledge including self-development, team knowledge and customer (internal) knowledge.
Deliver presentations to teams and executive leaders and sponsors.
NATURE AND SCOPE
Typically reports to Store Operations Process Manager or Store Operations Business Manager (or Sr. Managers)
No associates report to this role on a permanent basis, but requires the leadership of a work group: assign and review work, train and contribute to performance appraisal (but not hiring, firing or disciplinary action).
ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS
Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant condition
Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
Additional Environmental Job Requirements:

ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Education Required:
The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diplomas and/or GED.

Years of Relevant Work Experience: 3 years
Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Strong project management skills, including strong process orientation, ability to work in a cross-functional team environment
Good communication skills, including ability to interact with officers, also needs the ability to negotiate and persuade
Strong analytical skills and general understanding of technical concepts
Ability to establish priorities and procedures for accomplishing work within established deadlines; ability to handle multiple projects and manage toward deadlines and deliverables
Proven leadership skills, including a willingness and ability to be a mentor

Please review the following job description:
Support Information Security and Cyber Threat Management programs responding to cyber incidents while working in a multiple-team environment. Process vulnerability and threat data from a variety of internal and external sources to provide actionable intelligence to internal consumers in order to implement countermeasures and maintain and enhance the defenses for our information systems and resources. Serve as first escalation point for security investigations and provide oversight for tier I analysts, when the manager is not available. Assist senior analysts during incident response activities and cyber investigations.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Assist in escalated computer security incidents and cyber investigations including computer forensics, network forensics, root cause analysis and malware analysis.

2. Act as coordinator in the event of escalated cyber threats/incidents for Tier 1 analysts.

3. Execute on appropriate mitigation strategies for identified threats.

4. Participate in threat hunting activities to proactively search for threats in the enterprise environment.

5. Participate in the creation and maintenance of use cases for recurring investigation/incident triggers in support of the 24/7 Cyber Threat Operations and Cyber Threat Management program.

6. Participate in the creation and maintenance of playbooks used in response for investigation/incident triggers in support of 24/7 Cyber Threat Operations and Cyber Threat Management program.

7. Interface with other teams in Information Security (e.g. network operations, Cyber Threat Operations Center (CTOC), vulnerability management) along with information and liability risk officers and technology management to help guide cyber security strategy.

8. Adhere to all policies and standards, as well as regulatory requirements regarding reporting and escalations.

9. Work with team members to enhance and enrich security monitoring tools with contextual information.

10. Provide mentoring for junior level analysts.

11. Deliver cyber intelligence services and material to information technology and business leaders.

12. Identify new threat tactics, techniques and procedures used by cyber threat actors.

13. Publish actionable threat intelligence for business and technology management.

Required Skills and Competencies:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

1. Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent education and related training

2. Broad knowledge of general IT with a focus area in two or more of the following areas: operating systems, networking, computer programing, web development or database administration

3. Demonstrated advanced knowledge of cyber security operations with a focus area in two or more of the following: attack surface management, Security Operations Center (SOC) operations, Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) use, threats (including Advanced Persistent Threat (APT), insider) vulnerabilities, and exploits; incident response, investigations and remediation

4. Foundational knowledge of processes, procedures and methods to research, analyze and disseminate threat intelligence information

5. Ongoing passion for learning about information security through self-education

6. Ability to lead and persuade individuals and small teams on ideas, concepts and opportunities

7. Consistent history of delivering on commitments

8. Critical thinking and problem solving skills

9. Knowledge of the incident handling procedures and intrusion analysis models

10. Ability to work independently with limited supervision

11. Proven communication skills, both written and verbal, to both business and technology audiences

12. Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products

13. Ability to travel, occasionally overnight

Desired Skills:

1. Five years of experience

2. Industry certifications in general technology (e.g. Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP), Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE), Network+)

3. Industry certifications in cyber security and forensics, such as Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), GIAC Security Essentials (GSEC), Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), GIAC Certified Intrusion Analyst (GCIA), GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Security + and other related credentials

4. Security Operations Center (SOC) or Network Operations Center (NOC) experience

5. Experience in the Intelligence Community (IC)

6. Demonstrated leadership experience

Senior Business Analyst

Alpharetta, GA

Job Summary

The person selected for this role will use their communication and analytical skills to transform business need into technical requirements. You will bridge the gap between our internal customers and the technical team to document the scope and scale of critical processes and behaviors of new projects and major enhancements.

This team is critical to the organization in its role of mapping sourced motor vehicle data to internal databases that match their business needs. For this role, we need someone driven and willing to dig in to quickly learn our business while delivering high quality requirements. Serve as primary resource for development and maintenance of internal data standards and documentation for all MVR-related database design requirements. Also, serve as escalation to research/correct/resolve production data issues. The role will predominately focus on gathering and analyzing MVR data and requirements.

In addition to supporting new product implementations and major enhancements you will be working to help transition the team and organization into DevOps and agile to improve quality and speed to market.

Experience and Education
5+ years of IT business analyst experience
BS/BA degree in relevant discipline or equivalent experience required
Responsibilities
Acts as a primary point of contact for internal/external customer and third-party vendor inquiries/requests, responsible for clarifying and clearly understanding client/business objectives, strategies and needs.
Researches/gathers and refines business requirements, performs business intelligence assessments/analysis and cost benefit analysis; communicates findings/trends/relevant information effectively and proposes options/solutions; coordinates internal resources as needed and communicates progress/results
Responsible for facilitating clear understanding of all customer/business processes and procedures, goals/objectives and drivers in order to effectively define business solutions
Develops relationships with customers and other relevant parties to facilitate the flow of records and other important processes, procedures and other relevant business/customer needs
Ensures overall project plan effectiveness and timely issue resolution; addresses any significant fluctuations in project initiative regularly
Consults with and collaborates with both technical and non-technical audiences, including management staff and cross functional groups, vendors, and internal/external customers to review and assess work/data flow processes and areas of opportunity
Proactively maintains and enhances technical requirements documentation
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, or related degree; or equivalent related work experience.
Requires 3+ years strong research and business intelligence experience gathering/business analysis skills, knowledge and understanding of records/data collection, procedures and terminology
Ability to work independently and collaborate with cross functional groups as required
Knowledge of relational databases and query concepts
Requires exceptional oral and written communication skills, including articulating ideas and information in use case and sequence diagrams as well as detailed functional requirements
Possesses ability to collaborate effectively with personnel at all levels including various levels of management, staff, vendors, and clients.
Requires strong self-motivation, business acumen, customer service, consulting and interpersonal/ relationship development skills
Requires strong organizational skills including effectively handling multiple assignments and leading multiple projects/initiatives simultaneously and prioritizing work effectively
Requires ability to function within ambiguity and help bring clarity and/or resolution to complex situations and issues
Requires experience effectively identifying, researching, and coordinating the resources necessary to troubleshoot/diagnose client and business issues; possesses ability to probe, research and gain knowledge and understanding of internal and external business and data flow processes
Requires strong decision making skills including knowledge and experience with data flow process/procedures; must be able to research data fields and related data flow information and draw valid conclusions
Nice To Have
Knowledge of automobile insurance and MVR data

DutiesHelpDutiesSummaryThis position is with the U.S. Department of Labor/Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).* This position is outside the Bargaining Unit.* This position is a the Full Performance Level. (FPL)Learn more about this agencyResponsibilitiesMajor duties for this position include but are not limited to, the following:* Plans, develops, and implements the regional Management Analysis program and serves as the principal advisor to the ARA/AP. Conducts evaluations or analyses on a variety of management, personnel, or administrative support functions.* Evaluates the management activities and operations of the eleven Area Offices through on-site audits. Such activities include, but are not limited to, personnel practices and maintenance of personnel records, time and attendance practices, GSA vehicle management, budget management, supervision of grants related activities and records management. Supervises audit team members responsible for administrative function areas. Reviews their reports, analyzes collected data, and provides guidance as needed.* Recommends appropriate changes to improve organization, staffing, work methods, or procedures. Serves as the Regional point of contact for the Performance Management Program. Implements procedures for ensuring that managers effectively initiate employee performance plans and complete mid-term and annual performance evaluations in accordance with established time frames. Serves as an advisor to Regional management on labor management relations issues. Coordinates with OASAM on all recommended adverse actions and ensures management is adhering to procedures outlined in the current negotiated contract.* Conducts investigations of internal confidential issues in the Region. Makes recommendations for appropriate action to the ARA/AP. Establishes procedures for monitoring budget expenditures in all offices and makes recommendations for relocation when required.
